channel.title: Waterfall Issues :: K-State CIS 642/643 Textbook
channel.description: You may be wondering, if this model of software engineering was so widely adopted, why did so many software projects continue to fail? Of course, some development houses never adopted a formal model, and rather continued in cowboy coding practices. But there were also many flaws in how the waterfall model was commonly adopted. The ability to divide labor amongst the different phases was a boon from a business perspective, but it came with challenges.
